title: @Meddler where are u guys gonna post specifics about upcoming mage , dragon, blue & red changes?

Why are dragon, blue, and red changing yet AGAIN? Pls stahp.

Sincerely,
A jungle main.

http://i.imgur.com/F7ldG54.png[/img]

Because if they're not impactful they're not worth contesting. Neutral objectives should drive conflict throughout the game and should result in games that feel different from each other depending on which rewards you manage to take, how fights over them go, how well suited your team is to them etc. If that's not happening the result is safer games with significant slow periods. That's been a problem with dragon in particular for a while, with the correct play sometimes being to just ignore it and do the same thing every game. Red and Blue buff have also fallen in significance a lot compared to a couple of seasons ago when they were major drivers of interaction at times.
Its not that they dont have value, its that the risk of failing in those contests is too high, ie death timers being too high. Is blue buff worth possibly dying once and losing two towers while dead?

that would mean they arent worth the risk, increase the value and then all of a sudden they are. Also buffed stoped being contested in season 5, not 6, because the XP value on them droped so much compared to season 4, getting your buff stolen as a jungler nowadays is more of a minor inconvenience than an actual disadvantage.
So a blue buff should be worth a kill + 2 towers then? I dont think so....
no but buffs should be worth a lot more xp so counterjungling it is ACTUALLY worth it

I LIKE this. I've been slowly drifting away from JG as of late duo to the current state of the game. Counter jungling with the current setup of "free trinket + skuttles" is 9 times out of 10 more risky than the reward is worth. Also with the amount of free vision availible ganking is tough to pull off.

I can't imagine either buff being buffed in a way that would speed up jungle clear times by more than 5 seconds. I don't think you need to worry about it.

Blue buff in particular is having power put into its mana regen that will be much more noticeable late game than early game, so that's gonna make no difference. If anything I imagine it's the health regen on red buff that they'll improve.

Increased mana/health regen compared to live still wouldn't entice me to want to make any risky plays around contesting them, unless it was like mundo level of regen. The idea seems to be to make them worth fighting over, but they'd need more than just numerical tweaks imo for that to be the case, and special effects are prone to make jungle life easier (if not directly in clear times, then in ability to clear and then gank, or even just a straight buff to gank potential with no apparent trade off).

I haven't put much thought into it though, and perhaps theres some clever design that makes the buffs stronger without indirectly buffing jungler potential at the same time (which I don't feel like they need, plus I'm always wary of power creep). I guess we'll find out next week or so.
